title: NDRS-1137: small net instrumentation
body:
Adds some observability to the small_net networking component.

# Message classification

Network messages are classified into the following categories:

* `protocol`: Handshakes
* `consensus`
* `deploy_gossip`
* `address_gossip`
* `deploy_transfer`: Any traffic of deploys being requested directly (via joining or when downloading blocks)
* `block_transfer`: Any traffic of blocks being requested directly (mostly joining)
* `other`: Other traffic. Should be very rare.

# Metrics

Additional metrics are added, namely `net_out_count_*` and `net_out_bytes_`. These contain the summed up single message counts and total number of bytes transferred across the entire node for each category (e.g. `net_out_bytes_block_transfer` is the total number of bytes transferred to satisfy block requests).

# Tracing

Two tracing targets have been introduced, `net_out` and `net_in`. If set to the `TRACE` level, they mark and log each outgoing packet. `msg_id` or trace IDs are unique per message sent on a connection, even if the payload is identical.

Example:

```
{
  "timestamp": "Apr 19 14:49:15.239",
  "level": "TRACE",
  "fields": {
    "message": "sending",
    "msg_id": "19e5aee6f6880df3",
    "msg_size": 25,
    "msg_kind": "protocol"
  },
  "target": "net_out"
}
```

The log message above was recorded on node 1. On node 2, we can find the resulting `net_in` message:

```
{
  "timestamp": "Apr 19 14:49:15.239",
  "level": "TRACE",
  "fields": {
    "message": "received",
    "msg_id": "19e5aee6f6880df3",
    "msg_size": 25,
    "msg_kind": "protocol"
  },
  "target": "net_in"
}
```

The timestamp difference between both is 0, which means it got transferred in less than half a millisecond (not surprising, since we used loopback networking and are under no load).

To run with these traces enabled, `RUST_LOG` or equivalent can be used:

```
RUST_LOG=info,net_out=trace,net_in=trace
```

HWY-282: Do not request dependency that is already in the synchronizer queue.
body:
https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/HWY-282

Prior to the addition of [new logic](https://github.com/goral09/casper-node-1/blob/hwy-282/node/src/components/consensus/protocols/highway/synchronizer.rs#L373) we would try downloading a dependency (`c1`) that is already in the synchronizer's state. Now, instead, we will follow the vertices we already have and what those depend on and request the "lowest" one.

title: NDRS-1061, CEP 40: Simplify block types and remove redundant fields. (1.2.0 backport)
body:
This deduplicates the timestamp, height and parent information in the consensus proposal messages and replaces `ProtoBlock` and `CandidateBlock` with a single `BlockPayload` type.

That also means the `mem_proto_block_validator` metric gets renamed to `mem_block_payload_validator`.

[CEP 40](https://github.com/CasperLabs/ceps/blob/master/text/0040-block-proposal-message-cleanup.md)
https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1061

Backport of https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/pull/1290.

title: Release 1.1.0 to Master
NDRS-1073: add last_emergency_restart field to chainspec
body:
Ref: https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1073.

This PR introduces a field `last_emergency_restart` to the chainspec for use by fast sync.

Fast sync needs to ensure it doesn't traverse an emergency restart.  Since this information is not recorded anywhere on-chain, we need to provide it via the chainspec.

title: NDRS-1133 - Unifying fast-sync and linear-chain-sync
NDRS-1086: change SSE broadcast channel size to be a factor of event stream buffer size
body:
Ref: https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1086.

This PR removes `broadcast_channel_size` from the SSE config, instead making the value a factor (120%) of the `event_stream_buffer_length`.

We always want the broadcast channel size to be greater than the event stream buffer length so that a new client can retrieve the entire set of buffered events if desired.

@sacherjj @momipsl note that this PR changes the config.toml.

title: NDRS-1116: display full cause chain when logging errors
NDRS-1128: Collect only verified signatures from bonded validators.
body:
https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1128

Description of the bug being fixed:
When we receive a new linear chain block we collect all pending finality signatures that we had received for that block before the block itself was finalized on our own node. We should collect only finality signatures that we have already verified and that come from bonded validator. Unfortunately, we didn't wait for the last part – we would collect (and return) signatures that are valid but _might_ be from validators that are not bonded.

More details in the JIRA ticket.

That also means the `mem_proto_block_validator` metric gets renamed to `mem_block_payload_validator`.

[CEP 40](https://github.com/CasperLabs/ceps/blob/master/text/0040-block-proposal-message-cleanup.md)
https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1061

title: NDRS-1120: Add a delay before proposing dependencies.
body:
This adds a configurable delay between the time we receive a deploy (from a client or another full node) and the time we propose it in a block. The intention is to give deploys time to spread across the network via gossip, so that when we include them in a new block, the other nodes won't all have to ask us for the deploy.

https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1120

title: EE-1224: Remove transfer stored contracts
body:
Ref: https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/EE-1224

This PR removes stored transfer contracts whose functionality is replaced with wasmless transfer contracts.

title: NO-TICKET: Log the event type if it is too large.
body:
I was wondering about the "large event size" warnings in the tests, so I added more logging. Turns out the event itself is test-only, but it's still better to log the event type:

```
WARN  [c:reactor :448] large event size, consider reducing it or boxing; event_size=328; type_name="casper_node::components::gossiper::tests::Event"
```

title: EE-1216: Use checked math
body:
CHANGELOG:

- Used checked math functions like `checked_add` and other similar variants in a variety of places to avoid possible overflow
- Used checked math in `handle_payment` to future proof overflows in case of a change in the value of `REFUND_PERCENTAGE`
- Implemented `CheckedMul` and `CheckedSub` for `U512`
- Added `checked_add` for `EraId`

This PR removes `impl Sub<Timestamp> for Timestamp` as it made it somewhat easy to create code which could potentially panic in non-obvious edge cases.

It also introduces the first set of rountrip tests that are ensuring we can serialize/deserialize network messages from 1.0.0 and onwards.

title: NDRS-1121: Deduplicate block validity criteria.
body:
This adds the `AppendableBlock` type, which checks block validity when adding deploys and transfers, and uses that type both for proposing and validating blocks, to make sure the same criteria are applied in both cases.

https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1121

title: NDRS-1122: reduce default deploy TTL to 30 minutes
body:
Ref: https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1122

This PR updates the client by making the default time-to-live for a deploy 30 minutes.

title: NDRS-833: Refactor `LinearChain` to return outcomes not effects.
body:
This is the last PR in the "clean up `linear_chain` for tests" series. 

In this PR all the logic of the linear chain component that needs to access (and modify) the state of the component is moved to methods on the `LinearChain` state that are called `handle_*`. Each of these methods returns `Outcome(s)` that "describe" the type of effect we want to create. This allows for writing unit tests that exercise the high-level API of the `LinearChain` state without involving effects, futures, etc.

title: NDRS-1076: on hard reset of storage, remove all data associated with a removed block
body:
Ref: https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1076.

In a hard reset, blocks created in or after the specified era are deleted from storage, but associated data is left behind.  Associated data includes block bodies, block signatures and crucially deploy execution results associated with the deleted blocks.

This PR resolves that issue by removing the above mentioned associated data on a hard reset.

title: NDRS-1113: fix reconnecting if isolated
body:
Ref: https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1113.

This PR fixes a bug where a node which is a member of the known addresses can become isolated but not retry to connect to other known addresses.

It also improves the logging of an outgoing connection failure in two ways:
1. A lost outgoing connection where the peer ID is known is now only logged once
2. The log messages for peer ID known vs unknown are now even more different to help disambiguate them.

title: NDRS-833: `LinearChain` cleanup part 3.
body: Cleanup of the `LinearChain` component (in preparation for unit tests) continued. The main thing that changed in this PR is the addition of `LinearChainComponent` struct that wraps `LinearChain` and `LinearChainMetrics`. All component-level logic is now moved to the `LinearChainComponent` struct, rather than `LinearChain`. The latter does not deal with `Effect`, `REv`, `EffectBuilder`, `I` (peer id type), or any other code related to the reactor or networking. The functionality should be mostly unchanged. I tried working iteratively so reviewing commit-by-commit should be simpler than trying to do it all at once (although not necessarily take less time). I've found a couple of inconsistencies and potential sources of bugs around the handling of pending/cached finality signatures. Those should be now resolved.

title: EE-1213: Added get_balance using PublicKey
body:
REF: https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/EE-1213

CHANGELOG:

- Added a new function `EngineState::get_balance` which uses a `PublicKey` and returns a `BalanceResult`
- Added a new function `get_public_key_balance_result` to the WASM test builder to help with testing
- Added `get_balance_using_public_key_should_work` unit test

title: NDRS-1061: Remove ProtoBlock from FinalizedBlock and rename wasm_deploys.
body:
This is a refactoring, and a preparation for simplifying the block types, specifically for replacing `ProtoBlock` and `CandidateBlock` with a single type.

This PR removes `ProtoBlock` from `FinalizedBlock`, because the new type will contain fields (`accusations`) that would be redundant as a part of `FinalizedBlock`. It also renames `ProtoBlock::wasm_deploys` to `deploy_hashes`, and `transfers` to `transfer_hashes`, so that it is in line with `BlockBody`.

https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1061

body:
This introduces a protocol version field into the handshake, which is ignored by the V1.0.0 node. At the same time, if absent, V1.0.0 is filled in. As a result, every version of the release node software has a correct protocol version field.

~~**NOTE** This PR is due a rebase & force push once https://github.com/CasperLabs/casper-node/pull/1256 is merged to master.~~

**NOTE**: This second change is only meant to unblock us at the current juncture.  We should address how we intend to fix/replace these tests.

title: NO-TICKET: limit deploy size to 1MiB
body:
This PR limits the deploy size, both when accepting one in the node, and when creating one in the client.

The node was previously rejecting deploys greater than the permitted maximum block size.  It now rejects deploys with a serialized size of > 1MiB.  The serialized size is that provided by the `ToBytes` trait for the `Deploy` type.

The client also now checks that any deploy created is within this limit and avoids sending such an invalid deploy to the node.

body: This ensures that nodes are in agreement about what the maximum message size is through the chainspec.

The [fourth last commit](https://github.com/CasperLabs/casper-node/commit/48ca022fd0085d09f6b61134c3b72c9de7076929) is the actual merge and is probably the only one worth reviewing.

title: NDRS-833: `LinearChain` clean-up continued.
body:
Another clean-up PR that will make writing unit tests easier. In this PR:
* we wrap pending finality signatures with a struct (and extract it to a file) that guards the invariants of the pending collection,
* add methods on the signature cache to mutate the state, rather than mutating it directly from the component,
* move validation of the incoming signature out of the component-level logic (so that we can test it without involving the component)
* remove direct access to the signature cache from the component-level logic (it's now accessed only via methods on the `LinearChain` struct)
* remove direct access to the latest block from the component-level logic

title: NDRS-{1052,1053}: Prevent deploy replays. (Ports #1216, #1218, #1219, #1223 to dev.)
body:
This is a port of https://github.com/CasperLabs/casper-node/pull/1216, https://github.com/CasperLabs/casper-node/pull/1218, https://github.com/CasperLabs/casper-node/pull/1219, https://github.com/CasperLabs/casper-node/pull/1223 to the `dev` branch.

* Instead of persisting the `BlockProposerDeploySets` to LMDB and loading in on startup, we recreate that state from the collection of finalized deploys. This fixes a bug where that set would be incorrectly initialized for joining/restarting/upgrading nodes.
* Blocks are considered invalid if they contain the same deploy twice, or if they contain a deploy that was already present in any of their ancestors.

https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1052
https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1053

title: NDRS-1030: Disconnect from faulty peers
body:
This PR creates a new announcement for blocklisting, which is currently picked up by `small_network`. If enabled via configuration (currently disabled by default), the peer will be blocked. Regardless of configuration the event is logged.

As a consequence, it is possible to punish peers not only from consensus. As a nice side effect, the `ConsensusAnnouncement` is no longer generic over `I`.

title: NDRS-1025: Make get_era_validators take parameters directly from ChainspecLoader
body:
`get_era_validators` currently takes `activation_era_id`, `initial_state_root_hash` and `protocol_version` as arguments. All these values could, and should, be taken directly from the Chainspec Loader via a new request (or a set of new requests), so that the components calling `get_era_validators` won't have to store them.

https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1025

This change will change the `AccountHash` bytes of the system account to:

```
blake2b(b"system0")
```
(as defined by `AccountHash::from_public_key`)

title: OP-1932 :: NCTL :: Dangling Ports et al
body:
1. Added activate bid command.  
2. Deprecated obsolete svc_systemd file.  
3. Streamlined tearing down network.  
4. Added commands to view active ports/processes.

title: NDRS-1053: Add a parent to CandidateBlock.
body:
With deploy replay protection the validity of a candidate block depends not only on its contents and its timestamp, but also on its ancestors. So if there are two different vertices with identical consensus values, i.e. candidate blocks, one of them could be valid and one invalid. Whether a node would consider them valid would depend on which one was received first, because that would determine the set of ancestors we check against.

Adding the parent hash makes candidate block ancestors explicit so that consensus can rely on the validity result again: If a candidate block is deemed valid, we know that all vertices that carry it are valid.

https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/NDRS-1053

title: NDRS-1053: Introducing Protection Against Replay Attacks
NDRS-1052: Reconstruct `BlockProposerDeploySets` state from the block storage.
body:
Instead of persisting the `BlockProposerDeploySets` to LMDB and loading in on startup, we recreate that state from the collection of finalized deploys.

This fixes a bug where that set would be incorrectly initialized for joining/restarting/upgrading nodes.

title: NO TICKET: Fix key deserialization
body:
This PR fixes both bincode encoding and human readable JSON encoding for `Key`s used in the trie.

Further property tests are also introduced.

title: EE-1076: Recursive query limit
body:
Ref: https://casperlabs.atlassian.net/browse/EE-1076

This PR add a query depth limit.
    
This commit will ensure that arbitrarily long chains of named keys either a contract/account that references an account/contract, or a chain of urefs that references other urefs - will stop after exceeding fixed depth limit.

title: NO-TICKET: Bugfix for Block Proposer (dev)
body: It was possible that handling an old finalized block would rewind the next_finalized value. This PR removes that possibility.
